channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12863] Master info port on RS UI is always 0
item.description:
Not sure the reason. The link at the bottom of the RS UI back to master always lists 0 as the info port, thus fails when clicked.

Any takers ?
item.summary: Master info port on RS UI is always 0

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Assigned to myself.

The infoPort of master address data on zk is always 0.

I think the problem is the order of put master address on zk and start jetty server when starting HMaster.

In HMaster's constructor, we first become the active master and then start jettyServer


    startActiveMasterManager();

    putUpJettyServer();

We use masterInfoPort in startActiveMasterManager


    activeMasterManager = new ActiveMasterManager(zooKeeper, this.serverName,

        masterInfoPort, this);

But actually it is intialized in putUpJettyServer


    masterInfoPort = connector.getPort();

So we always get 0 infoPort...

Sorry, "we first become the active master and then start jettyServer" should be "we first start active master manager and then start jetty server" since we do not block on startActiveMasterManager call.

And this maybe introduced by HBASE-10483, the line below is added in the patch of HBASE-10483


masterInfoPort = connector.getPort();

Liu Shaohui

Duo Zhang
Sorry for bringing this problem and thanks for pointing out this problem.
Should we start the jettyServer first and then become the active master manager to fix this problem?

Liu Shaohui

Should we start the jettyServer first and then become the active master manager to fix this problem?

I think we must start jetty server first if we want to get infoPort in this way...

Duo Zhang
The reason why to get infoPort in this way is that in some cases eg, in yarn, we don't know which port is available before we start the http server. So we set the hbase.master.info.port to 0, and let the os assign a port for info server.
so let's try starting jetty server first~
change the order of startActiveMasterManager and putUpJettyServer
Web UI seems fine with this patch
+1. Thanks Duo Zhang

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12692468/HBASE-12863.patch
against master branch at commit 71184309e1762708bbfe1e1bdb8a2acf9c8c2b15.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12692468

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

This message is automatically generated.
LGTM! (reassigning to Duo Zhang. A question though - what is the state of server when jetty is up, but active master manager didn't run yet? I assume there's no inconsistency being introduced here...

Mikhail Antonov There is no direct access to activeMasterManager except starting and stoping HMaster. The only effect is 'isActiveMaster', but it is set in a Thread started in startActiveMasterManager. It is already set asynchronously without this patch so it does not make any difference with this patch I think.
will this introduce a race condition where in the UI will be accessing objects that haven't been initialized yet? Seems like a recipe for NPEs and 500 errors.
How about setting info port to ActiveMasterManager after Jetty server is up ?

This message is automatically generated.

Ran TestResourceFilter locally with patch v2 and it passed.

All tests in hbase-server passed in the above QA run.

we need to set the information to zookeeper，not only locally
Ted Yu
And I think patch v1 is enough for now since startActiveMasterManager is already a sync

I think we can do as follow
1. create ActiveMasterManager
2. start jetty server, get the actual infoPort
3. set infoPort of ActiveMasterManager
4. start ActivevMasterManager.

I will prepare a patch. Thanks~
Ted Yu Nick Dimiduk

add a testcase to verify infoPort on zk is not 0

And there is another bug in original code. We should use 'connector.getLocalPort' instead of 'connector.getPort'. 'getPort' will returned the configured port, not the actual port. If you set 0, it will return 0...
